# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string, text_width = 10)
    words = split(input_string, ' ')
    wrapped_lines = []
    for word in words
        if length(string(word)) > text_width
            push!(wrapped_lines, "\n$word")
        else
            push!(wrapped_lines, " $word "))
        end
    end
    return join(wrapped_lines)
end

# Example usage:
input_string = "This is a very long sentence that exceeds the maximum text width of 10 characters. Wrap it properly."
wrapped_output = wrap_string(input_string)
println(wrapped_output)
```
In this example, `wrap_string` takes an input string and a maximum text width. It iterates over each word, checking if its length exceeds the given width. If so, it adds a new line before the word. Finally, it returns the wrapped string.
